Lunarpine stopped suddenly, smelling the crow realizing the irony of 
the owls catch. All he could think how he'd under reacted to her 
trick.

The wolf transformed to bot again and lunged forward pinning the owl 
to the ground."You let your gaurd down before confirming the game was 
over." He raised a claw to the owls throat. "So what am I going to do 
with a dead carcas? 
" He lifted Shadow Wing into the ait claw still poised for the kill.

--- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, "Logo morph" <logomorph@h...> wrote:
> 
> ::Shadow Wing::
> 
> She knew that this game was more than a game.  It was a test.  She 
was 
> finding out what he could do.  And he was seeing what she was 
capable of.  
> She really didn't like tricking him like that.  But she wanted him 
to know 
> that She wasn't a feather brain.(bird joke) She wanted him to know 
that she 
> could think when she had to and let instinct take over when 
nessessary.  She 
> stopped at a brach about 20 feet off the ground and perched for a 
moment. 
> She looked up into a tree near her's and saw another bird. It was a 
nice, 
> fat crow.
> "How do you like your crow? Rare, Medium or Well done?"
> She didn't give him time to answer the question.  she swooped up 
and caught 
> the crow that was sitting in another tree. She flew down and 
dropped it 
> infront of Lunarpine.
> 
> "Sorry for the dirty trick I pulled. I'll be 'it' again if you 
want."
> She pushed the crow closer to him. "Peace offering?"
> 
>
